parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name or affiliation. It mentions "Andrioni Alin" and "Păun Gabriel," but these individuals are not identified as parliamentary candidates, and the context suggests a legal dispute unrelated to the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content is presented as a news report, aiming to reach a wide audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be reporting on a legal case involving a dispute between "Râul Alb" and individuals mentioned in the post.  While the subject matter touches upon environmental activism, which could indirectly relate to political stances, there is no direct call to action or attempt to influence votes in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents itself as a news report, summarizing a legal case. It includes a link to a news article, suggesting an attempt to inform the public about the outcome of a legal dispute. While the source is "Râul Alb," the style and content align with journalistic reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post expresses opinions about the actions of Andrioni Alin and Păun Gabriel, it does so within the context of reporting on a legal case. The opinions are presented as part of the factual reporting and not as a personal attack or an attempt to sway public opinion regarding the parliamentary elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1250313356238900</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while politically themed, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post reports on a legal case, presenting information in a manner consistent with journalistic reporting.  It does not directly advocate for or against any parliamentary candidate, nor does it attempt to influence voting behavior in the parliamentary elections. The individuals mentioned are not identified as candidates. The post's objective appears to be informing the public about a legal dispute, not influencing the outcome of the parliamentary elections.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Râul Alb</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
